title: Hey, Travis, Why Do You Need My Location?
subtitle: Is Travis spying on everyone?
body: <p>With HTML5 you can always view-source. On this site, I'm using <code>window.navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition</code> to get the longitude and latitude. Then with those I use the <a href="http://www.worldweatheronline.com/">nice free api provided by worldweatheronline.com</a>. The gist of what happens before it gets minified <a href="http://jsbin.com/jimaxo/1/edit?html,js,output">is in this JSBin</a>. I then take the resulting value for the current conditions an display a little CSS animated node that scrolls across. Learn more about geolocation at <a href="http://diveintohtml5.info/geolocation.html" title="by Mark Pilgrim">Dive Into HTML5</a> and <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/WebAPI/Using_geolocation">MDN's WebAPI geolocation documentation</a>.</p>
